<span id="L139" rel="#L139">139</span>
<span id="L140" rel="#L140">140</span>

<span id="L447" rel="#L447">447</span>
<span id="L448" rel="#L448">448</span>
<span id="L449" rel="#L449">449</span>
<span id="L450" rel="#L450">450</span>
<span id="L451" rel="#L451">451</span>
<span id="L452" rel="#L452">452</span>
<span id="L453" rel="#L453">453</span>
<span id="L454" rel="#L454">454</span>
<span id="L455" rel="#L455">455</span>
<span id="L456" rel="#L456">456</span>
<span id="L457" rel="#L457">457</span>
<span id="L458" rel="#L458">458</span>
<span id="L459" rel="#L459">459</span>
<span id="L460" rel="#L460">460</span>
</pre>
          </td>
          <td width="100%">
                  <div class="highlight"><pre><div class='line' id='LC1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;GNU LESSER GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE</div><div class='line' id='LC2'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Version 2.1, February 1999</div><div class='line' id='LC3'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC4'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Copyright (C) 1991, 1999 Free Software Foundation, Inc.</div><div class='line' id='LC5'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA</div><div class='line' id='LC6'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Everyone is permitted to copy and distribute verbatim copies</div><div class='line' id='LC8'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of this license document, but changing it is not allowed.</div><div class='line' id='LC9'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10'>[This is the first released version of the Lesser GPL.  It also counts</div><div class='line' id='LC11'>&nbsp;as the successor of the GNU Library Public License, version 2, hence</div><div class='line' id='LC12'>&nbsp;the version number 2.1.]</div><div class='line' id='LC13'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC14'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Preamble</div><div class='line' id='LC15'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC16'>&nbsp;&nbsp;The licenses for most software are designed to take away your</div><div class='line' id='LC17'>freedom to share and change it.  By contrast, the GNU General Public</div><div class='line' id='LC18'>Licenses are intended to guarantee your freedom to share and change</div><div class='line' id='LC19'>free software--to make sure the software is free for all its users.</div><div class='line' id='LC20'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC21'>&nbsp;&nbsp;This license, the Lesser General Public License, applies to some</div><div class='line' id='LC22'>specially designated software packages--typically libraries--of the</div><div class='line' id='LC23'>Free Software Foundation and other authors who decide to use it.  You</div><div class='line' id='LC24'>can use it too, but we suggest you first think carefully about whether</div><div class='line' id='LC25'>this license or the ordinary General Public License is the better</div><div class='line' id='LC26'>strategy to use in any particular case, based on the explanations below.</div><div class='line' id='LC27'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC28'>&nbsp;&nbsp;When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom of use,</div><div class='line' id='LC29'>not price.  Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that</div><div class='line' id='LC30'>you have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge</div><div class='line' id='LC31'>for this service if you wish); that you receive source code or can get</div><div class='line' id='LC32'>it if you want it; that you can change the software and use pieces of</div><div class='line' id='LC33'>it in new free programs; and that you are informed that you can do</div><div class='line' id='LC34'>these things.</div><div class='line' id='LC35'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC36'>&nbsp;&nbsp;To protect your rights, we need to make restrictions that forbid</div><div class='line' id='LC37'>distributors to deny you these rights or to ask you to surrender these</div><div class='line' id='LC38'>rights.  These restrictions translate to certain responsibilities for</div><div class='line' id='LC39'>you if you distribute copies of the library or if you modify it.</div><div class='line' id='LC40'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC41'>&nbsp;&nbsp;For example, if you distribute copies of the library, whether gratis</div><div class='line' id='LC42'>or for a fee, you must give the recipients all the rights that we gave</div><div class='line' id='LC43'>you.  You must make sure that they, too, receive or can get the source</div><div class='line' id='LC44'>code.  If you link other code with the library, you must provide</div><div class='line' id='LC45'>complete object files to the recipients, so that they can relink them</div><div class='line' id='LC46'>with the library after making changes to the library and recompiling</div><div class='line' id='LC47'>it.  And you must show them these terms so they know their rights.</div><div class='line' id='LC48'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC49'>&nbsp;&nbsp;We protect your rights with a two-step method: (1) we copyright the</div><div class='line' id='LC50'>library, and (2) we offer you this license, which gives you legal</div><div class='line' id='LC51'>permission to copy, distribute and/or modify the library.</div><div class='line' id='LC52'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC53'>&nbsp;&nbsp;To protect each distributor, we want to make it very clear that</div><div class='line' id='LC54'>there is no warranty for the free library.  Also, if the library is</div><div class='line' id='LC55'>modified by someone else and passed on, the recipients should know</div><div class='line' id='LC56'>that what they have is not the original version, so that the original</div><div class='line' id='LC57'>author&#39;s reputation will not be affected by problems that might be</div><div class='line' id='LC58'>introduced by others.</div><div class='line' id='LC59'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC60'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Finally, software patents pose a constant threat to the existence of</div><div class='line' id='LC61'>any free program.  We wish to make sure that a company cannot</div><div class='line' id='LC62'>effectively restrict the users of a free program by obtaining a</div><div class='line' id='LC63'>restrictive license from a patent holder.  Therefore, we insist that</div><div class='line' id='LC64'>any patent license obtained for a version of the library must be</div><div class='line' id='LC65'>consistent with the full freedom of use specified in this license.</div><div class='line' id='LC66'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC67'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Most GNU software, including some libraries, is covered by the</div><div class='line' id='LC68'>ordinary GNU General Public License.  This license, the GNU Lesser</div><div class='line' id='LC69'>General Public License, applies to certain designated libraries, and</div><div class='line' id='LC70'>is quite different from the ordinary General Public License.  We use</div><div class='line' id='LC71'>this license for certain libraries in order to permit linking those</div><div class='line' id='LC72'>libraries into non-free programs.</div><div class='line' id='LC73'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC74'>&nbsp;&nbsp;When a program is linked with a library, whether statically or using</div><div class='line' id='LC75'>a shared library, the combination of the two is legally speaking a</div><div class='line' id='LC76'>combined work, a derivative of the original library.  The ordinary</div><div class='line' id='LC77'>General Public License therefore permits such linking only if the</div><div class='line' id='LC78'>entire combination fits its criteria of freedom.  The Lesser General</div><div class='line' id='LC79'>Public License permits more lax criteria for linking other code with</div><div class='line' id='LC80'>the library.</div><div class='line' id='LC81'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC82'>&nbsp;&nbsp;We call this license the &quot;Lesser&quot; General Public License because it</div><div class='line' id='LC83'>does Less to protect the user&#39;s freedom than the ordinary General</div><div class='line' id='LC84'>Public License.  It also provides other free software developers Less</div><div class='line' id='LC85'>of an advantage over competing non-free programs.  These disadvantages</div><div class='line' id='LC86'>are the reason we use the ordinary General Public License for many</div><div class='line' id='LC87'>libraries.  However, the Lesser license provides advantages in certain</div><div class='line' id='LC88'>special circumstances.</div><div class='line' id='LC89'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC90'>&nbsp;&nbsp;For example, on rare occasions, there may be a special need to</div><div class='line' id='LC91'>encourage the widest possible use of a certain library, so that it becomes</div><div class='line' id='LC92'>a de-facto standard.  To achieve this, non-free programs must be</div><div class='line' id='LC93'>allowed to use the library.  A more frequent case is that a free</div><div class='line' id='LC94'>library does the same job as widely used non-free libraries.  In this</div><div class='line' id='LC95'>case, there is little to gain by limiting the free library to free</div><div class='line' id='LC96'>software only, so we use the Lesser General Public License.</div><div class='line' id='LC97'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC98'>&nbsp;&nbsp;In other cases, permission to use a particular library in non-free</div><div class='line' id='LC99'>programs enables a greater number of people to use a large body of</div><div class='line' id='LC100'>free software.  For example, permission to use the GNU C Library in</div><div class='line' id='LC101'>non-free programs enables many more people to use the whole GNU</div><div class='line' id='LC102'>operating system, as well as its variant, the GNU/Linux operating</div><div class='line' id='LC103'>system.</div><div class='line' id='LC104'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC105'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Although the Lesser General Public License is Less protective of the</div><div class='line' id='LC106'>users&#39; freedom, it does ensure that the user of a program that is</div><div class='line' id='LC107'>linked with the Library has the freedom and the wherewithal to run</div><div class='line' id='LC108'>that program using a modified version of the Library.</div><div class='line' id='LC109'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC110'>&nbsp;&nbsp;The precise terms and conditions for copying, distribution and</div><div class='line' id='LC111'>modification follow.  Pay close attention to the difference between a</div><div class='line' id='LC112'>&quot;work based on the library&quot; and a &quot;work that uses the library&quot;.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC113'>former contains code derived from the library, whereas the latter must</div><div class='line' id='LC114'>be combined with the library in order to run.</div><div class='line' id='LC115'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC116'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;GNU LESSER GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE</div><div class='line' id='LC117'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR COPYING, DISTRIBUTION AND MODIFICATION</div><div class='line' id='LC118'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC119'>&nbsp;&nbsp;0. This License Agreement applies to any software library or other</div><div class='line' id='LC120'>program which contains a notice placed by the copyright holder or</div><div class='line' id='LC121'>other authorized party saying it may be distributed under the terms of</div><div class='line' id='LC122'>this Lesser General Public License (also called &quot;this License&quot;).</div><div class='line' id='LC123'>Each licensee is addressed as &quot;you&quot;.</div><div class='line' id='LC124'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC125'>&nbsp;&nbsp;A &quot;library&quot; means a collection of software functions and/or data</div><div class='line' id='LC126'>prepared so as to be conveniently linked with application programs</div><div class='line' id='LC127'>(which use some of those functions and data) to form executables.</div><div class='line' id='LC128'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC129'>&nbsp;&nbsp;The &quot;Library&quot;, below, refers to any such software library or work</div><div class='line' id='LC130'>which has been distributed under these terms.  A &quot;work based on the</div><div class='line' id='LC131'>Library&quot; means either the Library or any derivative work under</div><div class='line' id='LC132'>copyright law: that is to say, a work containing the Library or a</div><div class='line' id='LC133'>portion of it, either verbatim or with modifications and/or translated</div><div class='line' id='LC134'>straightforwardly into another language.  (Hereinafter, translation is</div><div class='line' id='LC135'>included without limitation in the term &quot;modification&quot;.)</div><div class='line' id='LC136'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC137'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;Source code&quot; for a work means the preferred form of the work for</div><div class='line' id='LC138'>making modifications to it.  For a library, complete source code means</div><div class='line' id='LC139'>all the source code for all modules it contains, plus any associated</div><div class='line' id='LC140'>interface definition files, plus the scripts used to control compilation</div><div class='line' id='LC141'>and installation of the library.</div><div class='line' id='LC142'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC143'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Activities other than copying, distribution and modification are not</div><div class='line' id='LC144'>covered by this License; they are outside its scope.  The act of</div><div class='line' id='LC145'>running a program using the Library is not restricted, and output from</div><div class='line' id='LC146'>such a program is covered only if its contents constitute a work based</div><div class='line' id='LC147'>on the Library (independent of the use of the Library in a tool for</div><div class='line' id='LC148'>writing it).  Whether that is true depends on what the Library does</div><div class='line' id='LC149'>and what the program that uses the Library does.</div><div class='line' id='LC150'>&nbsp;&nbsp;</div><div class='line' id='LC151'>&nbsp;&nbsp;1. You may copy and distribute verbatim copies of the Library&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC152'>complete source code as you receive it, in any medium, provided that</div><div class='line' id='LC153'>you conspicuously and appropriately publish on each copy an</div><div class='line' id='LC154'>appropriate copyright notice and disclaimer of warranty; keep intact</div><div class='line' id='LC155'>all the notices that refer to this License and to the absence of any</div><div class='line' id='LC156'>warranty; and distribute a copy of this License along with the</div><div class='line' id='LC157'>Library.</div><div class='line' id='LC158'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC159'>&nbsp;&nbsp;You may charge a fee for the physical act of transferring a copy,</div><div class='line' id='LC160'>and you may at your option offer warranty protection in exchange for a</div><div class='line' id='LC161'>fee.</div><div class='line' id='LC162'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC163'>&nbsp;&nbsp;2. You may modify your copy or copies of the Library or any portion</div><div class='line' id='LC164'>of it, thus forming a work based on the Library, and copy and</div><div class='line' id='LC165'>distribute such modifications or work under the terms of Section 1</div><div class='line' id='LC166'>above, provided that you also meet all of these conditions:</div><div class='line' id='LC167'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC168'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a) The modified work must itself be a software library.</div><div class='line' id='LC169'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC170'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b) You must cause the files modified to carry prominent notices</div><div class='line' id='LC171'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;stating that you changed the files and the date of any change.</div><div class='line' id='LC172'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC173'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c) You must cause the whole of the work to be licensed at no</div><div class='line' id='LC174'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;charge to all third parties under the terms of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC175'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC176'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d) If a facility in the modified Library refers to a function or a</div><div class='line' id='LC177'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;table of data to be supplied by an application program that uses</div><div class='line' id='LC178'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the facility, other than as an argument passed when the facility</div><div class='line' id='LC179'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is invoked, then you must make a good faith effort to ensure that,</div><div class='line' id='LC180'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in the event an application does not supply such function or</div><div class='line' id='LC181'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;table, the facility still operates, and performs whatever part of</div><div class='line' id='LC182'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;its purpose remains meaningful.</div><div class='line' id='LC183'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC184'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(For example, a function in a library to compute square roots has</div><div class='line' id='LC185'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a purpose that is entirely well-defined independent of the</div><div class='line' id='LC186'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;application.  Therefore, Subsection 2d requires that any</div><div class='line' id='LC187'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;application-supplied function or table used by this function must</div><div class='line' id='LC188'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be optional: if the application does not supply it, the square</div><div class='line' id='LC189'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;root function must still compute square roots.)</div><div class='line' id='LC190'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC191'>These requirements apply to the modified work as a whole.  If</div><div class='line' id='LC192'>identifiable sections of that work are not derived from the Library,</div><div class='line' id='LC193'>and can be reasonably considered independent and separate works in</div><div class='line' id='LC194'>themselves, then this License, and its terms, do not apply to those</div><div class='line' id='LC195'>sections when you distribute them as separate works.  But when you</div><div class='line' id='LC196'>distribute the same sections as part of a whole which is a work based</div><div class='line' id='LC197'>on the Library, the distribution of the whole must be on the terms of</div><div class='line' id='LC198'>this License, whose permissions for other licensees extend to the</div><div class='line' id='LC199'>entire whole, and thus to each and every part regardless of who wrote</div><div class='line' id='LC200'>it.</div><div class='line' id='LC201'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC202'>Thus, it is not the intent of this section to claim rights or contest</div><div class='line' id='LC203'>your rights to work written entirely by you; rather, the intent is to</div><div class='line' id='LC204'>exercise the right to control the distribution of derivative or</div><div class='line' id='LC205'>collective works based on the Library.</div><div class='line' id='LC206'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC207'>In addition, mere aggregation of another work not based on the Library</div><div class='line' id='LC208'>with the Library (or with a work based on the Library) on a volume of</div><div class='line' id='LC209'>a storage or distribution medium does not bring the other work under</div><div class='line' id='LC210'>the scope of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC211'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC212'>&nbsp;&nbsp;3. You may opt to apply the terms of the ordinary GNU General Public</div><div class='line' id='LC213'>License instead of this License to a given copy of the Library.  To do</div><div class='line' id='LC214'>this, you must alter all the notices that refer to this License, so</div><div class='line' id='LC215'>that they refer to the ordinary GNU General Public License, version 2,</div><div class='line' id='LC216'>instead of to this License.  (If a newer version than version 2 of the</div><div class='line' id='LC217'>ordinary GNU General Public License has appeared, then you can specify</div><div class='line' id='LC218'>that version instead if you wish.)  Do not make any other change in</div><div class='line' id='LC219'>these notices.</div><div class='line' id='LC220'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC221'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Once this change is made in a given copy, it is irreversible for</div><div class='line' id='LC222'>that copy, so the ordinary GNU General Public License applies to all</div><div class='line' id='LC223'>subsequent copies and derivative works made from that copy.</div><div class='line' id='LC224'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC225'>&nbsp;&nbsp;This option is useful when you wish to copy part of the code of</div><div class='line' id='LC226'>the Library into a program that is not a library.</div><div class='line' id='LC227'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC228'>&nbsp;&nbsp;4. You may copy and distribute the Library (or a portion or</div><div class='line' id='LC229'>derivative of it, under Section 2) in object code or executable form</div><div class='line' id='LC230'>under the terms of Sections 1 and 2 above provided that you accompany</div><div class='line' id='LC231'>it with the complete corresponding machine-readable source code, which</div><div class='line' id='LC232'>must be distributed under the terms of Sections 1 and 2 above on a</div><div class='line' id='LC233'>medium customarily used for software interchange.</div><div class='line' id='LC234'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC235'>&nbsp;&nbsp;If distribution of object code is made by offering access to copy</div><div class='line' id='LC236'>from a designated place, then offering equivalent access to copy the</div><div class='line' id='LC237'>source code from the same place satisfies the requirement to</div><div class='line' id='LC238'>distribute the source code, even though third parties are not</div><div class='line' id='LC239'>compelled to copy the source along with the object code.</div><div class='line' id='LC240'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC241'>&nbsp;&nbsp;5. A program that contains no derivative of any portion of the</div><div class='line' id='LC242'>Library, but is designed to work with the Library by being compiled or</div><div class='line' id='LC243'>linked with it, is called a &quot;work that uses the Library&quot;.  Such a</div><div class='line' id='LC244'>work, in isolation, is not a derivative work of the Library, and</div><div class='line' id='LC245'>therefore falls outside the scope of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC246'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC247'>&nbsp;&nbsp;However, linking a &quot;work that uses the Library&quot; with the Library</div><div class='line' id='LC248'>creates an executable that is a derivative of the Library (because it</div><div class='line' id='LC249'>contains portions of the Library), rather than a &quot;work that uses the</div><div class='line' id='LC250'>library&quot;.  The executable is therefore covered by this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC251'>Section 6 states terms for distribution of such executables.</div><div class='line' id='LC252'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC253'>&nbsp;&nbsp;When a &quot;work that uses the Library&quot; uses material from a header file</div><div class='line' id='LC254'>that is part of the Library, the object code for the work may be a</div><div class='line' id='LC255'>derivative work of the Library even though the source code is not.</div><div class='line' id='LC256'>Whether this is true is especially significant if the work can be</div><div class='line' id='LC257'>linked without the Library, or if the work is itself a library.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC258'>threshold for this to be true is not precisely defined by law.</div><div class='line' id='LC259'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC260'>&nbsp;&nbsp;If such an object file uses only numerical parameters, data</div><div class='line' id='LC261'>structure layouts and accessors, and small macros and small inline</div><div class='line' id='LC262'>functions (ten lines or less in length), then the use of the object</div><div class='line' id='LC263'>file is unrestricted, regardless of whether it is legally a derivative</div><div class='line' id='LC264'>work.  (Executables containing this object code plus portions of the</div><div class='line' id='LC265'>Library will still fall under Section 6.)</div><div class='line' id='LC266'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC267'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Otherwise, if the work is a derivative of the Library, you may</div><div class='line' id='LC268'>distribute the object code for the work under the terms of Section 6.</div><div class='line' id='LC269'>Any executables containing that work also fall under Section 6,</div><div class='line' id='LC270'>whether or not they are linked directly with the Library itself.</div><div class='line' id='LC271'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC272'>&nbsp;&nbsp;6. As an exception to the Sections above, you may also combine or</div><div class='line' id='LC273'>link a &quot;work that uses the Library&quot; with the Library to produce a</div><div class='line' id='LC274'>work containing portions of the Library, and distribute that work</div><div class='line' id='LC275'>under terms of your choice, provided that the terms permit</div><div class='line' id='LC276'>modification of the work for the customer&#39;s own use and reverse</div><div class='line' id='LC277'>engineering for debugging such modifications.</div><div class='line' id='LC278'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC279'>&nbsp;&nbsp;You must give prominent notice with each copy of the work that the</div><div class='line' id='LC280'>Library is used in it and that the Library and its use are covered by</div><div class='line' id='LC281'>this License.  You must supply a copy of this License.  If the work</div><div class='line' id='LC282'>during execution displays copyright notices, you must include the</div><div class='line' id='LC283'>copyright notice for the Library among them, as well as a reference</div><div class='line' id='LC284'>directing the user to the copy of this License.  Also, you must do one</div><div class='line' id='LC285'>of these things:</div><div class='line' id='LC286'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC287'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a) Accompany the work with the complete corresponding</div><div class='line' id='LC288'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;machine-readable source code for the Library including whatever</div><div class='line' id='LC289'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;changes were used in the work (which must be distributed under</div><div class='line' id='LC290'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sections 1 and 2 above); and, if the work is an executable linked</div><div class='line' id='LC291'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with the Library, with the complete machine-readable &quot;work that</div><div class='line' id='LC292'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;uses the Library&quot;, as object code and/or source code, so that the</div><div class='line' id='LC293'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;user can modify the Library and then relink to produce a modified</div><div class='line' id='LC294'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;executable containing the modified Library.  (It is understood</div><div class='line' id='LC295'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that the user who changes the contents of definitions files in the</div><div class='line' id='LC296'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Library will not necessarily be able to recompile the application</div><div class='line' id='LC297'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to use the modified definitions.)</div><div class='line' id='LC298'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC299'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b) Use a suitable shared library mechanism for linking with the</div><div class='line' id='LC300'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Library.  A suitable mechanism is one that (1) uses at run time a</div><div class='line' id='LC301'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;copy of the library already present on the user&#39;s computer system,</div><div class='line' id='LC302'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;rather than copying library functions into the executable, and (2)</div><div class='line' id='LC303'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will operate properly with a modified version of the library, if</div><div class='line' id='LC304'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the user installs one, as long as the modified version is</div><div class='line' id='LC305'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;interface-compatible with the version that the work was made with.</div><div class='line' id='LC306'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC307'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c) Accompany the work with a written offer, valid for at</div><div class='line' id='LC308'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;least three years, to give the same user the materials</div><div class='line' id='LC309'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;specified in Subsection 6a, above, for a charge no more</div><div class='line' id='LC310'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;than the cost of performing this distribution.</div><div class='line' id='LC311'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC312'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d) If distribution of the work is made by offering access to copy</div><div class='line' id='LC313'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;from a designated place, offer equivalent access to copy the above</div><div class='line' id='LC314'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;specified materials from the same place.</div><div class='line' id='LC315'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC316'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;e) Verify that the user has already received a copy of these</div><div class='line' id='LC317'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;materials or that you have already sent this user a copy.</div><div class='line' id='LC318'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC319'>&nbsp;&nbsp;For an executable, the required form of the &quot;work that uses the</div><div class='line' id='LC320'>Library&quot; must include any data and utility programs needed for</div><div class='line' id='LC321'>reproducing the executable from it.  However, as a special exception,</div><div class='line' id='LC322'>the materials to be distributed need not include anything that is</div><div class='line' id='LC323'>normally distributed (in either source or binary form) with the major</div><div class='line' id='LC324'>components (compiler, kernel, and so on) of the operating system on</div><div class='line' id='LC325'>which the executable runs, unless that component itself accompanies</div><div class='line' id='LC326'>the executable.</div><div class='line' id='LC327'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC328'>&nbsp;&nbsp;It may happen that this requirement contradicts the license</div><div class='line' id='LC329'>restrictions of other proprietary libraries that do not normally</div><div class='line' id='LC330'>accompany the operating system.  Such a contradiction means you cannot</div><div class='line' id='LC331'>use both them and the Library together in an executable that you</div><div class='line' id='LC332'>distribute.</div><div class='line' id='LC333'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC334'>&nbsp;&nbsp;7. You may place library facilities that are a work based on the</div><div class='line' id='LC335'>Library side-by-side in a single library together with other library</div><div class='line' id='LC336'>facilities not covered by this License, and distribute such a combined</div><div class='line' id='LC337'>library, provided that the separate distribution of the work based on</div><div class='line' id='LC338'>the Library and of the other library facilities is otherwise</div><div class='line' id='LC339'>permitted, and provided that you do these two things:</div><div class='line' id='LC340'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC341'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a) Accompany the combined library with a copy of the same work</div><div class='line' id='LC342'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;based on the Library, uncombined with any other library</div><div class='line' id='LC343'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;facilities.  This must be distributed under the terms of the</div><div class='line' id='LC344'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sections above.</div><div class='line' id='LC345'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC346'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b) Give prominent notice with the combined library of the fact</div><div class='line' id='LC347'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that part of it is a work based on the Library, and explaining</div><div class='line' id='LC348'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where to find the accompanying uncombined form of the same work.</div><div class='line' id='LC349'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC350'>&nbsp;&nbsp;8. You may not copy, modify, sublicense, link with, or distribute</div><div class='line' id='LC351'>the Library except as expressly provided under this License.  Any</div><div class='line' id='LC352'>attempt otherwise to copy, modify, sublicense, link with, or</div><div class='line' id='LC353'>distribute the Library is void, and will automatically terminate your</div><div class='line' id='LC354'>rights under this License.  However, parties who have received copies,</div><div class='line' id='LC355'>or rights, from you under this License will not have their licenses</div><div class='line' id='LC356'>terminated so long as such parties remain in full compliance.</div><div class='line' id='LC357'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC358'>&nbsp;&nbsp;9. You are not required to accept this License, since you have not</div><div class='line' id='LC359'>signed it.  However, nothing else grants you permission to modify or</div><div class='line' id='LC360'>distribute the Library or its derivative works.  These actions are</div><div class='line' id='LC361'>prohibited by law if you do not accept this License.  Therefore, by</div><div class='line' id='LC362'>modifying or distributing the Library (or any work based on the</div><div class='line' id='LC363'>Library), you indicate your acceptance of this License to do so, and</div><div class='line' id='LC364'>all its terms and conditions for copying, distributing or modifying</div><div class='line' id='LC365'>the Library or works based on it.</div><div class='line' id='LC366'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC367'>&nbsp;&nbsp;10. Each time you redistribute the Library (or any work based on the</div><div class='line' id='LC368'>Library), the recipient automatically receives a license from the</div><div class='line' id='LC369'>original licensor to copy, distribute, link with or modify the Library</div><div class='line' id='LC370'>subject to these terms and conditions.  You may not impose any further</div><div class='line' id='LC371'>restrictions on the recipients&#39; exercise of the rights granted herein.</div><div class='line' id='LC372'>You are not responsible for enforcing compliance by third parties with</div><div class='line' id='LC373'>this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC374'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC375'>&nbsp;&nbsp;11. If, as a consequence of a court judgment or allegation of patent</div><div class='line' id='LC376'>infringement or for any other reason (not limited to patent issues),</div><div class='line' id='LC377'>conditions are imposed on you (whether by court order, agreement or</div><div class='line' id='LC378'>otherwise) that contradict the conditions of this License, they do not</div><div class='line' id='LC379'>excuse you from the conditions of this License.  If you cannot</div><div class='line' id='LC380'>distribute so as to satisfy simultaneously your obligations under this</div><div class='line' id='LC381'>License and any other pertinent obligations, then as a consequence you</div><div class='line' id='LC382'>may not distribute the Library at all.  For example, if a patent</div><div class='line' id='LC383'>license would not permit royalty-free redistribution of the Library by</div><div class='line' id='LC384'>all those who receive copies directly or indirectly through you, then</div><div class='line' id='LC385'>the only way you could satisfy both it and this License would be to</div><div class='line' id='LC386'>refrain entirely from distribution of the Library.</div><div class='line' id='LC387'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC388'>If any portion of this section is held invalid or unenforceable under any</div><div class='line' id='LC389'>particular circumstance, the balance of the section is intended to apply,</div><div class='line' id='LC390'>and the section as a whole is intended to apply in other circumstances.</div><div class='line' id='LC391'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC392'>It is not the purpose of this section to induce you to infringe any</div><div class='line' id='LC393'>patents or other property right claims or to contest validity of any</div><div class='line' id='LC394'>such claims; this section has the sole purpose of protecting the</div><div class='line' id='LC395'>integrity of the free software distribution system which is</div><div class='line' id='LC396'>implemented by public license practices.  Many people have made</div><div class='line' id='LC397'>generous contributions to the wide range of software distributed</div><div class='line' id='LC398'>through that system in reliance on consistent application of that</div><div class='line' id='LC399'>system; it is up to the author/donor to decide if he or she is willing</div><div class='line' id='LC400'>to distribute software through any other system and a licensee cannot</div><div class='line' id='LC401'>impose that choice.</div><div class='line' id='LC402'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC403'>This section is intended to make thoroughly clear what is believed to</div><div class='line' id='LC404'>be a consequence of the rest of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC405'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC406'>&nbsp;&nbsp;12. If the distribution and/or use of the Library is restricted in</div><div class='line' id='LC407'>certain countries either by patents or by copyrighted interfaces, the</div><div class='line' id='LC408'>original copyright holder who places the Library under this License may add</div><div class='line' id='LC409'>an explicit geographical distribution limitation excluding those countries,</div><div class='line' id='LC410'>so that distribution is permitted only in or among countries not thus</div><div class='line' id='LC411'>excluded.  In such case, this License incorporates the limitation as if</div><div class='line' id='LC412'>written in the body of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC413'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC414'>&nbsp;&nbsp;13. The Free Software Foundation may publish revised and/or new</div><div class='line' id='LC415'>versions of the Lesser General Public License from time to time.</div><div class='line' id='LC416'>Such new versions will be similar in spirit to the present version,</div><div class='line' id='LC417'>but may differ in detail to address new problems or concerns.</div><div class='line' id='LC418'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC419'>Each version is given a distinguishing version number.  If the Library</div><div class='line' id='LC420'>specifies a version number of this License which applies to it and</div><div class='line' id='LC421'>&quot;any later version&quot;, you have the option of following the terms and</div><div class='line' id='LC422'>conditions either of that version or of any later version published by</div><div class='line' id='LC423'>the Free Software Foundation.  If the Library does not specify a</div><div class='line' id='LC424'>license version number, you may choose any version ever published by</div><div class='line' id='LC425'>the Free Software Foundation.</div><div class='line' id='LC426'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC427'>&nbsp;&nbsp;14. If you wish to incorporate parts of the Library into other free</div><div class='line' id='LC428'>programs whose distribution conditions are incompatible with these,</div><div class='line' id='LC429'>write to the author to ask for permission.  For software which is</div><div class='line' id='LC430'>copyrighted by the Free Software Foundation, write to the Free</div><div class='line' id='LC431'>Software Foundation; we sometimes make exceptions for this.  Our</div><div class='line' id='LC432'>decision will be guided by the two goals of preserving the free status</div><div class='line' id='LC433'>of all derivatives of our free software and of promoting the sharing</div><div class='line' id='LC434'>and reuse of software generally.</div><div class='line' id='LC435'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC436'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NO WARRANTY</div><div class='line' id='LC437'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC438'>&nbsp;&nbsp;15. BECAUSE THE LIBRARY IS LICENSED FREE OF CHARGE, THERE IS NO</div><div class='line' id='LC439'>WARRANTY FOR THE LIBRARY, TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW.</div><div class='line' id='LC440'>EXCEPT WHEN OTHERWISE STATED IN WRITING THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND/OR</div><div class='line' id='LC441'>OTHER PARTIES PROVIDE THE LIBRARY &quot;AS IS&quot; WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY</div><div class='line' id='LC442'>KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE</div><div class='line' id='LC443'>IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR</div><div class='line' id='LC444'>PURPOSE.  THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO THE QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE OF THE</div><div class='line' id='LC445'>LIBRARY IS WITH YOU.  SHOULD THE LIBRARY PROVE DEFECTIVE, YOU ASSUME</div><div class='line' id='LC446'>THE COST OF ALL NECESSARY SERVICING, REPAIR OR CORRECTION.</div><div class='line' id='LC447'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC448'>&nbsp;&nbsp;16. IN NO EVENT UNLESS REQUIRED BY APPLICABLE LAW OR AGREED TO IN</div><div class='line' id='LC449'>WRITING WILL ANY COPYRIGHT HOLDER, OR ANY OTHER PARTY WHO MAY MODIFY</div><div class='line' id='LC450'>AND/OR REDISTRIBUTE THE LIBRARY AS PERMITTED ABOVE, BE LIABLE TO YOU</div><div class='line' id='LC451'>FOR DAMAGES, INCLUDING ANY GENERAL, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR</div><div class='line' id='LC452'>CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE</div><div class='line' id='LC453'>LIBRARY (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO LOSS OF DATA OR DATA BEING</div><div class='line' id='LC454'>RENDERED INACCURATE OR LOSSES SUSTAINED BY YOU OR THIRD PARTIES OR A</div><div class='line' id='LC455'>FAILURE OF THE LIBRARY TO OPERATE WITH ANY OTHER SOFTWARE), EVEN IF</div><div class='line' id='LC456'>SUCH HOLDER OR OTHER PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH</div><div class='line' id='LC457'>DAMAGES.</div><div class='line' id='LC458'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC459'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;END OF TERMS AND CONDITIONS</div><div class='line' id='LC460'><br/></div></pre></div>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
  </div>

          </div>
        </div>

        <a href="#jump-to-line" rel="facebox" data-hotkey="l" class="js-jump-to-line" style="display:none">Jump to Line</a>
        <div id="jump-to-line" style="display:none">
          <h2>Jump to Line</h2>
          <form accept-charset="UTF-8" class="js-jump-to-line-form">
            <input class="textfield js-jump-to-line-field" type="text">
            <div class="full-button">
              <button type="submit" class="button">Go</button>
            </div>
          </form>
        </div>

      </div>
    </div>
</div>

      </div>
